item.title: Fluid Dynamics
item.description: Bernoulli Equation and Fluid Moving on a Streamline Don’t bother with the derivation: $$\frac{p}{\gamma} + \frac{V^2}{2g} + z = \text{constant} = \text{total head} = H$$ total head is sorta the same thing as total energy $$\frac{p}{\gamma} + z = \text{static head} = \text{piezometric head}$$ velocity head is just the velocity part Head Loss The head loss is given by: $$h_L = \frac{2 \bar{\tau}_0 L}{\gamma r}$$ $$h_L = f \frac{L}{D} \frac{V^2}{2g}$$ $$h_L = K \frac{V^2}{2g}$$ K = loss coefficient
